This universal assembly altar of sixteen cubits has both extensive and concise versions.
The extensive version refers to making two hundred and nine lotus seats within the sixteen cubits;
the concise version refers to making one hundred and thirty-nine lotus seats within the sixteen cubits.

if the patron lacks various kinds of excellent offerings and seven precious vessels, and the acharya does not have many intelligent and sharp disciples, then a concise altar should be made.
